name: Mesquite-Marinated Salmon Tacos
author: Karen Schmitt
summary: My husband loves Mexican food, but with my Philadelphia roots, I could not see the attraction. After 16 years in the Southwest, I created this dish to please us both. A little compromise turned into the best tacos in Arizona.
ingredients: 1 small red onion, halved lengthwise and thinly sliced
¼ cup salsa, or to taste
1/4 cup broccoli sprouts, or to taste
directions: Cut salmon into bite-sized cubes and place in a glass or ceramic bowl
Cover with mesquite marinade and toss to coat
Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and marinate in the refrigerator for 20 to 30 minutes
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Heat taco shells in the preheated oven for 3 minutes
Meanwhile, heat oil in a large frying pan
Add onion and saute until soft, 2 to 3 minutes
Add salmon and cook until no longer pink, 3 to 5 minutes
Fill taco shells with salmon and top with cheese, olives, salsa, and sprouts
